About Me

Hi, my name is Deepak Jaiswal and I’m a Roboticist. I’m experianced in developing products from scratch. I’m passionate about Robotics, ROS, A.I, M.L, D.L, Embedded Systems, Industry 4.0 and Algorithms. I have worked at a number of companies gaining teamwork and leadership skills.

I am most skilled in: Robotics and AI/ML tools

The objective of this scheme is to foster curiosity, creativity, and imagination in young minds; and inculcate skills such as design mindset, computational thinking, adaptive learning, physical computing etc.

Projects

LIMHA

Live machine health analysis. M.L., FFT, DSP, machine to machine communication, failure prediction.

I started this project to reduce machine downtime, Project LIMHA is focused on real time machine behavior analysis, it is a complete system with various level of computation like mist, fog & Edge computing. 9 axis accelation transmitted to cluster of edge computers becomes a AI supercomputer and runs ML algorithms to do real time anomaly, decriptive, prescriptive & predictive analysis on the Edge.

MPICV

magnetic partical inspection using computer vision. (crack detection), NDT, CV

Replaced human inspector which was 80% accuracy due to UV enviornment, developed low cost product to do non destructive testing under dark light. product based on vision camera as input and SoC as Edge computing unit which detect and learn human inspector behavior to take decision on quality analysis.

Data Management Handbook for Industry 4.0

https://sibc.se/isblrt

Digitalization is a joint working group under ISBLRT (India Sweden Business Leaders Roundtable) for sharing knowledge, to collaboration and to do business. This handbook is a result of that work.

ISBLRT is as a high-level platform for business leaders from Sweden and India to identify joint challenges in the fields of research, innovation, investments, financing, trade, business, industrialization and regulatory issues which need to be addressed to forge a strong and durable relationship between the two countries. This forum of business leaders will identify collaborations, draw upon best practices, and advise political leadership on both sides, on the way forward to quickly develop our relationship from bilateral, European and global business perspectives.

PufferFish ventilator (Stanford University)

https://www.pez-globo.org/

PufferFish is a rapidly manufacturable open-source full featured ventilator.

Pufferfish is an open-source, full-featured ICU ventilator. It is the result of a communal effort to design a solution that is low-cost, can be manufactured rapidly and is clinically relevant for COVID-19 patients. With peak flow rate above 300 l/min, Pufferfish can be used to provide both invasive and noninvasive ventilation as well as high flow oxygen therapy.

VITAL software V0.2 (JPL NASA)

https://medeng.jpl.nasa.gov/covid-19/ventilator/

JPL developed prototype with emergency use authorization from the FDA, VITAL: Ventilator Intervention Technology Accessible Locally

As a licensee for VITAL (covid-19 ventilator device) we developed software V0.2 to manufacture and distribute ventilators across INDIA. The VITAL ventilator is unique, versatile, and designed for more acutely ill patients. It will satisfactorily meet the demands of those who require aggressive ventilatory support in a variety of clinical states, which may include low compliance, high resistance, hypoxia and hypercapnia

Sanjeevani (covid-19)

SpO2 Based Smart Oxygen Delivery System for patients suffering from state of hypoxia.

Sanjeevani the proposed system is a Smart Oxygen Delivery System for Covid-19 Patients . Considering current situation, oxygen delivery systems are the need of time. Patients are needed to be monitored thoughout day and night based on their SpO2(Blood Oxyegn Saturation) levels, and pulse levels oxygen should be supplied to save patients sinking into the state of Hypoxia. This smart system can be a boon during the current situation to the medical faternity.

CEPA (agriculture)

Controlled Environment Precision Agriculture.

An Indian initiative in the field of precision agriculture - CEPA (Controlled Environment Precision Agriculture) Research and planned two type of intelligent robotic solutions, 1. CEPA-Cartesian which is work in closed environment with high precision. 2. CEPA-Rover, an intelligent electric vehicle with station and feedback who do land preparation, seeding, crop management, irrigation and harvesting autonomously.

AURORA (medical)

AURORA - Autonomous Robot Radiologist.

This project started to save lives of newborn babies and pregnant women’s, AURORA - Autonomous Robot Radiologist. Vision behind this project is to scan, monitor autonomously on remote location and predict the future health condition using intelligent system. Robots planed – cartesian system based and Delta mechanism.

The Roboseum

https://sciencecity.gujarat.gov.in/ticketing/ticket/robotics-gallery-40

India's first robot gallery with 66 deifferent sections.

Project Manager of The Roboseum, design and developements of all types of robots like domestic, industrial, commercial, entertainment, surgical etc. India to establish the world’s first robot themed science center, to be called “the Roboseum”. Commissioned during October ‘17 by Gujarat’s chief minister

Space Robot (replica of NASA robonaut)

Humanoid robot

The human-like head consists of 2 cameras acting as the eyes of the robot and 2 speakers as the ears of the robot. The eye movements and the head movements are independent of each other. 5 DOF in each arm,16 DOF in each hand, 10 fingers sensors, 10 independent motorized fingers with silicon grip, 1 Kinect (gesture capture, 3D depth recognition), 1 PIR SENSOR (PRESENCE DETECTION)

SPLICE 3D printer

April 2017 - May 2018

Splice 3DP module enables to print a multi-coloured object using single extruder, This Device based on Arduino. Key Features: Arduino, Stepper Motor, G-code, 3D Printer, Splicer Unit, Filament cutter, Communication b/w multiple devices.

Peltier based tent air conditioner

June 2017 - October 2017

As suggested by name it was planned to design a small portable solar powered air-conditioner for camping tent with some extra features like display humidity temperature, time etc., can be used as power backup for electronics devices.

Test stand for harmonic drives

Febuary 2017 - June 2017

This research was initiated to build a test stand to analyzed various characteristics of Harmonic Drives like horizontal/vertical torque, vibration and heat changes, also they were able to communicate with other Test stands

Harmonic actuated low orbit satellite tracking

January 2017 - Febuary 2017

The goal of this project was to design a PAN and TILT High precision mechanism and mount a digital telescope over it and track low orbit satellite (International Space Station) using image processing, Object Tracking.

Estimation vehicle speed using image processing

June 2016 - January 2017

It was a solo project that, Keywords:Image Processing;Kalman Filter; Automated vehicle Detection; Traffic Densities Counting;MATLAB. The processed images were recorded by a fixed camera positioned in two pedestrian bridges. Along with the video images procurement, manual vehicle counting was completed to validate the automated counting tool.

buyrobo.in

buyrobo.in

October 2016

It is an e-commerce website for robotics, electronics components and project solutions. design and develop product which was 1/10 of market price, all products was commercialised to promote STEM education.

Industrial Robotics ARM

May 2016

Industrial hand for pick and place objects from conveyor belt using PLC and Arduino. The technology used: Arduino, Delta PLC, Infrared sensors, Metal detector, Servo Motors.

Ear recognition system

March 2016

This project was built to detect and recognize human EAR using neural network and image acquisition toolbox. For this we used MATLAB as a processing tool. We did image preprocessing to remove unwanted information of ear images, also performed steps like image segmentation and feature extraction to get desirable shape of ear for ear recognition system purpose.

Face recognition based attendance system for classrooms.

March 2016

Multiple face recognition from a single photograph and automatically saved and marked in excel sheet. Technology: Principle Component Analysis, MATLAB, Neural Network. Calculate the eigen value of the captured face image and compared with that of the existing face images. If the eigen values matches, then the recognition process will start soon. Using PCA algorithm the following steps would be followed Find the face information of matched face image in the database. Update the log table with corresponding face image and system time that makes completion of attendance for an individual students.

Face recognition System.

January 2016

Human face detection and recognition using viola jones and Eigenvalue algorithm, 4000 images in 4 second with 96% accuracy.

FACIAL FEATURE DETECTION AND RECOGNITION

January 2016

Human facial feature detection such as Mouth, eyes, ears, nose and Smile.Technology used: Facial feature extraction, MATLAB.

STEM Traning modules

January 2016

Developed various training modules for School/College students, 6th sense technology, Vision Robotics, A.I., IoT, Bluetooth controlled the robot, Gesture controlled Robot, Industrial Automation, Advanced Embedded System.

MATuino

December 2015

Developed Graphical based programming enviornment for kids under 10. MATuino is about prototyping innovative tech ideas which involves Python , Arduino, Raspberry Pi and data and image analytics. nterfacing Arduino UNO with MATLAB without using any supporting inbuilt functions. So , for answering all those queries I am posting this article by explaining MATLAB & Arduino UNO serial communication .

Product based on S4A

November 2015

Designed Arduino programming environment using scratch software for 6+ age of children’s. S4A is a Scratch modification that allows for simple programming of the Arduino open source hardware platform. It provides new blocks for managing sensors and actuators connected to Arduino. There is also a sensors report board similar to the PicoBoard one.

mouse control using hand gesture

October 2015

Controlled mouse pointer using colour finger caps, created an algorithm for tracking different colours at a single time and according to the frame locations interface the mouse pointer. Technology used: Computer Vision, MATLAB and JAVA.

Ball tracking robot

October 2015

Object tracking robot vision-enabled robotic vehicle, which is able to track and follow any, specified object. Technology Used: Image Acquisition toolbox using MATLAB, Arduino.

Fully automatic stairs climbing robot (robocon 2012)

The theme for Robocon 2012 declared by Hong Kong, "Peng On Dai Gat". It was won by University of Electronic Science and Technology of China.

It was a fully autonomous machine which capable of climbing stairs of maximum height 25cm with a maximum load of 10Kg on it, It was embedded with wall sensing and collision avoidance. Technology Used: 6 High Torque DC Motors, IRFP 640 power MOSFETs, heavy current relays, ULN2803, BC547, ADC, PWM, and ATMEGA 32.

Automatic heavy load carrying transporter robot (robocon 2012)

The theme for Robocon 2012 declared by Hong Kong, "Peng On Dai Gat". It was won by University of Electronic Science and Technology of China.

It was a fully autonomous robot capable of picking an object of maximum weight 10 kg and placing that to any predefined point, it can sense the object at a range of 50 cm, and based on wall sensing and collision avoidance

Semi Automatic manual robot (robocon 2012)

The theme for Robocon 2012 declared by Hong Kong, "Peng On Dai Gat". It was won by University of Electronic Science and Technology of China.

It was a semi-autonomous robot capable of carrying an 80kg human and 50 kg load, it can grab anything by using a pneumatic hand can extend to 2 meter and able to lift 50 kg weight up to 2 meters of height.
